Posts.Content: Thank you for taking the time to reply. You are all so lovely on here.  Ì know I'm jumping the gun with all these questions etc....i think in my head, if I get organised and accept everything that is going to happen, then if/when I hear the news next week I can absorb all the information that will be given, quickly and calmly & make decisions in a quick timely manner so I don't delay any treatment faffing about!  Obviously I'm hoping they will say it's nothing...but the way things have been worded so far...its definately something. .  Preparing for the worst then any better news will be a bonus.  Thanks again....this weekend is going to feel spook long. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Lilyboo...i have no lump either...i had a bit of raised skin and incredibly itchy boob. .I thought I was allergic to the washing powder. It a only because I watched Stand up to cancer the real full monty that made me book a go appt. Thank you. I will let you know the outcome & if it is I would really appreciate any info you can forward to me. Thank you for reading a4ndadvising. Wednesday cant cone quick enough so i know what im facing. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you. The nerves are kicking in now. This time tomorrow I will know the outcome. I received a letter from the consultant yesterday..all the usual history, what happened etc.. one if the last sentences was "if the biopsies show malignancy then it will inflammatory in nature". I was doing ok but seeing what I had self diagnosed in black and white potentially being right sent me back to the sick feeling again.  My partner is being amazing, we both bad separate wobbles at the weekend, as his wife died of breast cancer, & he was starting to relive the scenario...but we are good to go now...rhank you for your advice & information...id rather be equipped for the worse case anything else is a bonus. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: It was positive for grade 2 inflammatory breast cancer. I start chemo in the next couple of weeks then mastectomy and radiotherapy...a long road ahead, but I'm feeling positive at the moment. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi it is lousy news...but I'm positive at the moment. It is hormone receptive..which is proving to be a nightmare seeing as I was on hrt patches after a hysterectomy last year. I've got a full body scan on Thursday then it's all systems go...6 x chemo, mastectomy & radiotherapy awaits. Thanks for your support. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: I think because my partner lost his wife to breast cancer when she was 31, his boys were only 7 and twins that were 4, it's making it far more difficult to be "ok" with it. We're getting through it one day at a time but it's so hard for him not to compare...he is so worried for me because he only knows of the bad outcome. I really feel for him, to have i go through jt twice is just crap..and so incredibly unfair. xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you for confirming it. Can I ask how old you are and what stage of treatment you are at now if you were diagnosed in January. I just want to know how fast you get treatment and how to cope with a mastectomy. I've tried to get that in my head but u would imagine that's one if the harder bits to deal with (May be not feeling womanly) I know its not the be all and end all... but I'm sure I'm not the only one to be anxious about it!! Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: I'm so lucky for support...i work in a doctor's surgery, my sister is a nurse and one if my best mates is a Marie curie nurse. Plus my partner is being amazing considering he has been through it before & lost his wife.  I've asked him not to come for the results...my sister is coming....i know she will love lunch!! I promise I will let you know.. it's so reassuring to speak to someone that has experienced all this, at such a young age but being so so positive about the outcome.take care.  Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you. Well the results were as expected. I have grade 2 inflammatory breast cancer.  The consultant was amazing. Held my hands saying it s 100% curable. A long road ahead but with the support I've had so far from family and friends and continued support on here I know I can kick it's ass!!! So oncologist Friday to let me know plans for chemo to begin with, then what ever is thrown at me next. Thank you for helping me through the oasr week. Onwards and upwards now. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you so much......i haven't googled anything else...now I've got a general idea what's potentially going to happen I don't want to know anymore. It was the not knowing anything I struggled with. My first post on here was straight after the biopsies were taken and I was in major shock. My partner lost his wife to breast cancer at age 31, so it is a difficult position to be in as he has been here before...he is going to be comparing every comment to that time. In a way i think that is helping me to be more positive as I'm protecting him from the hurt...it my be different after the results...but I know he will be there when he is needed most. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Bless you. I love the people on here. So open & honest & really really helpful. I wish you well with your recovery. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Im seriously not phased by any of it yet...i just want to get started!!! It's a horrible feeling knowing you've got cancer..but no definitive plan!! I know  it will all happen quickly after the scan....but I just want to  know when this rollercoaster will start now!!! Thank you for your support. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Wow...25. That so young. I am 44. I had a hysterectomy last year due to heavy painful periods & a family history of uterine cancer...so thought that would be the end if my cancer worries. Thank you for taking the time to tell me your journey, I have read that it is a rare aggressive cancer so it is reassuring to speak to someone else that has got it & fighting it. I know at the moment I am self diagnosing (but there hasn't been a box left unticked on the list of symptoms) but to know I'm not alone what ever the outcome is a wonderful reassuring feeling. Thank you. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: If it needs to happen for me to get well then so be it...i think with everybody's support on here I can't do anything else but be strong & positive. Thank you. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: I had a mammogram and ultrasound on Monday...where 2 suspicious areas were found. One in my breast and one in my lymph node. I've had them both biopsied and I will get the results on 25/4. I was stressed and have consulted Dr Google & truly believe I have inflammatory breast cancer. I feel calmer for reading it, strangely. But was just wondering if anyone else has had this type of cancer and what the potential process is from diagnosis. Thank you  x
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: I was officially diagnosed 2 days ago. Grade 2 inflammatory breast cancer. I see the oncologist later today to get started on chemo. I feel strangely positive and calm at the moment, so hanging onto that as long as possible. I'm scared of course I am but trying to laugh as much as possible to help me through. Xxx
Posts.Title: What is the prognosis for inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: I found out my chemo will start next Friday 11/5. All of a sudden it's real and I'm scared  xxx
